full_title_en: Maddrey's Discriminant Function for Alcoholic Hepatitis
medium_description_en: Suggests which patients with alcoholic hepatitis may have a poor prognosis and benefit from steroid administration.

seo.meta_description_en: The Maddrey’s Discriminant Function suggests which patients with alcoholic hepatitis may have a poor prognosis and benefit from steroid administration.
seo.keywords_en: maddrey function, liver function maddrey, bilirubin maddrey, serum bilirubin, pt serum liver, Alcoholic hepatitis, liver function, maddrey liver, maddrey discriminant, maddrey function, maddrey alcoholic, maddrey serum liver, mddrey bilirubin, maddrey function calc, maddrey discriminant calc, maddrey discriminant function for alcoholic hepatitis, maddrey discriminant function alcohol, maddrey discriminant function calc, maddrey discriminant function hepatitis, maddrey discriminant function hep, maddrey discriminant function alcohol hep, maddrey discriminant function etoh, maddrey etoh, maddrey etoh hep, maddrey etoh hepatitis

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en: Maddrey's Discriminant Function is useful in predicting short-term prognosis but is less useful for long-term prognosis.

next_steps.advice_en: Scores above 32 typically suggest poor prognosis and that these patients may be helped by steroid administration.
next_steps.management_en: Refer to ACG guidelines for management of idiosyncratic drug-induced liver injury.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Maddrey WC, Boitnott JK, Bedine MS, Weber FL, Mezey E, White RI (1978). Corticosteroid therapy of alcoholic hepatitis. Gastroenterology 75 (2): 193–9. PMID 352788

Validation.text: Soultati AS, et. al. Predicting utility of a model for end stage liver disease in alcoholic liver disease. World J Gastroenterol 2006 July 07;12(25):4020-4025

creator_info.about_en: Willis Maddrey, MD, is professor of internal medicine and assistant to the president at The University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center at Dallas. Previously, he directed the liver unit at The Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine and was chairman of the Department of Medicine at Jefferson Medical College. Dr. Maddrey has authored numerous publications based on research interests in chronic viral hepatitis, drug-induced liver disease, alcohol-induced liver disease, liver transplantation, and primary biliary cirrhosis.

guidelines.text: Diagnosis and Management of Idiosyncratic Drug-Induced Liver Injury
